ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about narration, the types of factors involved in creating film, the styles and techniques of particular directors, and how to thoroughly analyze a film. I also watched very popular films and learned how to look deeper into them as well as how to relate them to other films.
I learned a lot about analyzing films as well as terminology and theory that can inform our understanding of them!
This course taught me about looking closely at film techniques to understand what a film accomplishes artistically.

I learned how to share and communicate ideas between a small group of peers. My communication skills improved immensely. I also learned how to precisely analyze and increased my critical thinking skills.
how to analyze cinema through the lens of various theories + camera techniques

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths = Once a week. The screening is relatively short. The movies are engaging and there are some recent ones. The presentation aspect of the class also allows for engaging analysis and discussion. The readings were not burdening.
I love the seminar format and the framing with student presentations.

The strengths were the films on the syllabus and the presentations we did. A negative would be that lectures didn't cover enough about close analysis techniques in general and talked more about the films we saw specifically.
enjoyed the seminar format, especially student presentations

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student because this class is very engaging and you learn so much about film and how to analyze and look deeper into films that you would otherwise look at superficially. This class gives a good summary of what analyzing film is all about.
Yes! It's a great class and you watch some fantastic films, old and new!
Great, fascinating course, taught by a wonderful professor. Fascinating content. Discussions each week are fun and engaging. Incredibly manageable workload. Great class.
Yes, this is a great course to learn about films at a deep level.

very much recommend! I know it's part of the required FMS sequence but the content I learned in this class was unique. I think other film classes often focus on symbolism and can sometimes feel hand-wavy, whereas this one was more low-level/technical and the content felt concrete.
